meanings.definition: Failure of a pod or capsule to split open and release its seeds.
meanings.sent1: The indehiscence of the pod prevented the seeds from dispersing.
meanings.sent2: The farmer noticed the indehiscence of the capsule, leading to poor seed distribution.
meanings.sent3: The indehiscence of the pod played a prank on the seeds, keeping them trapped inside.
meanings.sent4: The indehiscence of the capsule was like a locked door, denying the seeds their freedom.
meanings.sent5: The indehiscence of the pod was a stubborn barrier, holding back the seeds' escape.

meanings.sent1: The indehiscence of the fruit was a unique characteristic of the plant.
meanings.sent2: Scientists studied the indehiscence of the seed to understand its growth process.
meanings.sent3: The indehiscence of the flower caused it to stand out among the rest in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The indehiscence of the plant symbolized its resilience in harsh conditions.
meanings.sent5: The indehiscence of the tree was a testament to its ability to adapt and survive.
